title: kukoro-chan
body: A female [[knight]] summoned from another world to help save Sutegoro Inc. Her nickname is derived from the Japanese meme phrase [[ku koro]], roughly translating to "Urgh, (just) kill me!"

title: shounan_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Shounan[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[twintails]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her default (and only) outfit is the Shibafu-design [i]Ukuru[/i]-class uniform: a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with [[blue sailor collar]], [[white hat|white]] [[sailor hat]], [[white socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with her sisters: a handheld 12 cm single gun, [[depth charge]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her aft hull (includes depth charge throwers, mast, Type 13 [[radar]], funnel, bridge) to her back. She also carries a [[blue bag]] with her, containing additional depth charges.

She was named after [[Singapore]] under Japanese occupation. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #4925094

h4. [i]Ukuru[/i]-class escort ships

h6. [i]Ukuru[/i] group

* [[Ukuru (kancolle)|]]
* [[Inagi (kancolle)|]]

h6. [i]Hiburi[/i]-class

* [[Hiburi (kancolle)|]]
* [[Daitou (kancolle)|]]
* [b]Shounan[/b]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): IJN [i]Shounan[/i]":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%98%AD%E5%8D%97_(%E6%B5%B7%E9%98%B2%E8%89%A6)]
other_names: 昭南(艦隊これくしょん)

title: daitou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Daitou[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] in a [[low ponytail]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Shibafu-design [i]Ukuru[/i]-class uniform due to her and her sisters Hiburi and Shounan being built to a modified design: a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with [[blue sailor collar]], [[white hat|white]] [[sailor hat]], [[white socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with her sisters: a handheld 12 cm single gun, [[depth charge]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her aft hull (includes depth charge throwers, mast, Type 13 [[radar]], funnel, bridge) to her back. She also carries a [[blue bag]] with her, containing additional depth charges.

title: also_sprach_zarathustra_(neco)
body:
Also known as "A-Z:". A series of illustrations by [[neco]] depicting girls (all named after letters of the alphabet) with futuristic combat gear and weapons that combine both melee weapons and firearms.

h4. Characters
* [[A (neco)|]] (gray hair, orange eyes, tanned, bident)
* [[B (neco)|]] (ash-blonde hair, pink eyes, katana)
* [[C (neco)|]] (long pink hair, gray eyes, crossbow)
* [[D (neco)|]] (short gray hair with long locks, blue eyes, halberd)
* [[E (neco)|]] (short lavender hair with long locks, lavender eyes, axe)
* [[F (neco)|]] (white hair, yellow eyes, sword and rifle)
* [[M (neco)|]] (looks similar to B?)
* [[P (neco)|]] (white hair, red eyes)
* [[S (neco)|]] (aqua hair, aqua eyes, rapier)

title: masked_hammer_kirby
body: An 3rd and final evolved form of [[Hammer Kirby]] in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]].

title: wild_hammer_kirby
body: An 2nd evolved form of [[Hammer Kirby]] in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]].

title: archer_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]], [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]], and the [[Kirby Fighters 2|Kirby Fighters series]] which lets [[Kirby]] fire off several [[arrow (projectile)|arrows]] at once.

!asset #24731395: Icon

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[hat]] with a [[hat feather|feather]] inside it, and he holds a [[bow (weapon)|bow]] and often an [[arrow (projectile)|arrow]].

title: spear_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]], [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe|its remake]], [[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]], and [[Kirby: Battle Royale]] which lets [[Kirby]] wield a [[spear]].

!asset #24731394: Icon

In this form, Kirby wears a [[red headband]] with a notable yellow [[forehead protector]] in its center.

title: hammer_kirby
body: A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] wield an insanely powerful [[hammer]]. !asset #24731384: Icon In this form, Kirby wears a [[two-tone headband|two-tone]] [[hachimaki]] in [[white headband|white]] and [[blue headband|blue]] (though in some games it is pure [[white headband|white]]). He also wields an [[huge weapon|oversized]] [[hammer]] that resembles [[King Dedede|King Dedede's]] own mallet. Evolved Forms: * [[Toy Hammer Kirby]] * [[Wild Hammer Kirby]] * [[Masked Hammer Kirby]]

title: sword_kirby
body: A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets Kirby wield a [[sword]]. !asset #24731388: Icon In this form, Kirby wears a floppy [[green headwear|green]] [[hat]] with a [[pom pom (clothes)|pom pom]] at its tip and holds a [[sword]]. Related Abilities: * [[Fire kirby|Fire]] Sword * [[ice kirby|Ice]] Sword * [[spark kirby|Thunder]] Sword * [[Ultra Sword Kirby|Ultra Sword]] * [[Gigant Sword Kirby|Gigant Sword]] * [[Meta Knight Sword Kirby|Meta Knight Sword]] * [[Morpho Knight Sword Kirby|Morpho Knight Sword]] * [[Sword Hero]] Related Characters: * [[Blade Knight]] * [[Sword Knight]] * [[Heavy Knight]] * [[Sodory]] * [[Gigant Edge]] / [[Wild Edge]] * [[Kracko]], [[Bugzzy]] ([[Kirby: Right Back At Ya]]!)

title: burning_kirby
body:
Burning is a [[Copy Ability]] used by [[Kirby]], letting him turn into a flaming ball. It is also referred to as Fireball, Burn, or Flame.

!asset #24731361: Icon

In some games, Burning Kirby has a crown with a flame insignia. In [i][[Kirby's Dream Buffet]][/i], Burning Kirby resembles a red chili pepper.

Burning Kirby is replaced by [[Fire Kirby]] in most later games, with Burning's main attack part of Fire's moveset. Fire Kirby can be distinguished by [[breathing fire]], and the flaming tiara he wears in most appearances.

title: needle_kirby
body: A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] shoot [[needle|needles]] at enemies. !asset #24731353: Icon In this form, Kirby wears a [[pink headwear|pink]] [[baseball cap]] with a yellow visor that is decorated with countless [[needle|needles]]. In some games, Kirby's skin turns [[yellow skin|yellow]]. Evolved Forms: * [[Clutter Needle Kirby]] * [[Crystal Needle Kirby]]

title: stone_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] turn into a hard block of [[stone]].

!asset #24731348: Icon

This form's design has varied over the years, but in its modern form, Kirby wears rocks on his head and a [[multicolored headband]] that comes in [[purple headband|purple]], [[pink headwear|pink]], and [[orange headwear|orange]], alongside a pair of [[white horns]]. In its older forms, Kirby's skin would turn [[brown skin|brown]] or [[grey skin|grey]] and he would wear a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[helmet]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hat ribbon|ribbon]] at the end like a tail.

title: spark_kirby
body:
A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] [[electrocution|electrocute]] any enemy that approaches him.

!asset #24731338: Icon

In this form, Kirby wears a [[gold headwear|gold]] [[tiara]] with a [[blue gemstone]] in its center with several waves of blue [[electricity]] coming off of his head.

title: kurahashi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Kurahashi[/i]. Character designed by [[Acea4]]. 

In-game, she is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] tied in [[twintails]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Mikura[/i]-class uniform: a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[blue sailor collar]], knotwork tie, [[white kimono|white]] [[undershirt]], [[red_skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[hip_vent|hip vents]], [[white hat|white]] [[sailor hat]], [[white gloves]], [[white socks]] with a red trim, and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her real-life funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, [[depth charge]]s on her [[brown belt]] and left [[thigh strap]], and [[paravane]]s on her ankles. Worth noting are the Type 2 amphibious tank and Kouhyouteki stickers on her back rig, reflective of her convoy duties that marked her entire career.

h4. Skins

* !post #5439195: Base
* !post #5439198: [[Kurahashi Kai (kancolle)|Kai form]]

h4. [i]Mikura[/i]-class escort ships

* [[Mikura (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Noumi (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Kurahashi[/b]
* [[Yashiro (Kancolle)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Kurahashi[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_escort_ship_Kurahashi]
other_names: 倉橋(艦隊これくしょん)

title: yashiro_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Yashiro[/i]. Character design by [[Acea4]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Mikura[/i]-class uniform: a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[blue sailor collar]], knotwork tie, [[white kimono|white]] [[undershirt]], [[red_skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[hip_vent|hip vents]], [[white hat|white]] [[sailor hat]] with a sunflower pin, [[white gloves]], [[white socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her real-life funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, [[depth charge]]s on her [[brown belt]] and left [[thigh strap]], and an additional 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] on her right thigh strap.

The seventh of the class, she was handed over to Taiwan as ROCS [i]Cheng An[/i], serving until 1963.

h4. Skins

* !post #3994438: Base
* !post #5238666: Spring
* !post #4071864: [[Yashiro (yukata) (kancolle)|Yukata]]

h4. [i]Mikura[/i]-class escort ships

* [[Noumi (kancolle)|]]

title: hiiragi_iwashi
body: A cooked [[fish head|sardine head]] on a holly branch, used to ward off [[oni]] during [[setsubun]].

title: inseki
body:
Romantic or sexual relations between non-blood relatives, e.g. step-parents or step-siblings.

h4. See also

* [[incest]]
* [[step-siblings]]
* [[step-parent and step-child]]

title: chained_together
body: 2024 3D platformer game developed and published by Anegar Games. Connected by a chain, players must cooperate to escape hell.

title: the_king_of_fighters_2001
body:
The eighth game of [[SNK]]'s [[The King of Fighters]] series. This game also signifies the end of the NESTS arc. Players can now alter the number of players and Strikers per team (i.e. you can have 4 players without Strikers or 1 player with 3 Strikers). This is also the first game SNK produced during bankruptcy with a little help from Korean company Eolith.

title: the_king_of_fighters_2002
body:
The ninth game of [[SNK]]'s [[The King of Fighters]] series. This game has no story and is considered a "Dream Match" game. This is also the only game that was produced by Playmore due to SNK's bankruptcy. The Striker system has been omitted in this game. It later got an upgrade called "The King of Fighters 2002: Unlimited Match" produced by the revived SNK Playmore.

The sixth game of [[SNK]]'s [[The King of Fighters]] series. This game signifies the beginning of the NESTS Saga and the gameplay style has been altered so that you can have a striker assist you. The game got an update called "The King of Fighters '99: Evolution" with the addition of Extra Strikers. title: the_king_of_fighters_'98
body:
The fifth game of [[SNK]]'s [[The King of Fighters]] series. The game has no story and is considered a "Dream Match". This game later gained an update called "The King of Fighters '98: Ultimate Match", complete with the addition of the mix-and-match Ultimate Mode.

title: love_live!_superstar!!
body:
The fourth installment of the [[Love Live!]] franchise, set at Yuigaoka Girls' High School, near Omotesando, Harajuku, and Aoyama. 

It follows Liella!, a school idol group in the newly minted Yuigaoka, in their attempts to claim victory in the Love Live! national tournament.

It is the second installment to introduce new members after the series has started, and the first to have a third season.

title: isolde_(kof)
body:
A character exclusive to [[The King of Fighters 2002]]: Unlimited Match. Isolde is [[Nameless (Kof)|]]'s first love who takes the form of a sad yet beautiful young girl who is a part of NESTS' Anti-K' Project (much like [[Kula Diamond]] is), thus granting her ice powers.

She eventually died due to an experimental failure and her soul and spirit now lies in Nameless's glove to control his flames.

title: etorofu_(rainy_season)_(kancolle)
body:
The tsuyu/rainy season [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Etorofu (kancolle)|]]. 

She wears a casual outfit consisting of a [[striped shirt]] and a [[long_skirt|long]] [[black skirt]]. She is also wearing [[rubber boots]], carrying a [[satchel]] and holding a [[pink umbrella]] with [[teruterubouzu]] hanging from it, one of them in her own effigy. Upon being damaged, her satchel has been revealed to contain [[depth_charge|depth charges]] and her shredded skirt also reveals her (equally damaged) bike shorts.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3158311

title: ino_abbav
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986.

[b]Ino Abbav[/b] is a member of [[Judau Ashta]]'s original gang of [[machinery]] scavengers. A calm and friendly tall teen with light brown hair and a [[bowl cut]], Ino later becomes part of the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i].

title: yazan_gable
body:
[quote][i]"I'M GOING TO VIOLATE YOU...!!!"[/i] - Yazan Gable[/quote]

A fictional [[Gundam]] character from [[Zeta Gundam]] and [[Gundam ZZ]]. 

In [i]Zeta[/i], he's a ferocious [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[war]] maniac whose skills allow him to go at it on par with multiple powerful Newtypes like [[Kamille Bidan]], and is most known for piloting the [[Gaplant]] and the [[Hambrabi]], from which he utters his infamous quote at Bidan. 

However, his fate drastically turns in [i]ZZ[/i], as his attempts at stealing the Zeta Gundam end up foiled repeatedly by [[Judau Ashta]], and the former ace of the Titans ends up left on the junker colony of Shangri-La, empoverished and in rags. [spoiler]A popular [[otaku|fan]] theory regarding Yazan's change in conduct explains that the long stasis inside his MS escape capsule caused permanent brain damage on him and dementia due to lack of oxygen, just like how it had happened to [[Tem Ray]] years before.[/spoiler]

title: kamen_rider_j
body:
Hero of the [[Kamen Rider J (movie)|]] film.

After dying while trying to save his sister, Koji Segawa is brought back to life by the earth spirits as Kamen Rider J to combat an invading alien force.

J is nearly identical to ZO except for his green trim and ability to grow in size, much like the heroes of the [[Ultra Series]].

title: girls'_frontline_2:_exilium
body:
A Chinese smartphone and PC game developed by Mica Team. A sequel to the original [[Girls' Frontline]], set ten years after the starting events of that game. Nicknamed the "anime [[X-COM]]", due to its adoption of its gameplay style.

Unlike the first game, each 'Tactical Doll' is now given a proper name, instead of using a codename based on their imprinted weapon of choice.

title: den'an_zon
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam F91]] anime film from 1991.

[b]XM-01 Den'an Zon[/b]

The primary [[mobile suit]] of the [[Crossbone Vanguard]], the Den'an Zon represented the true form of the miniaturized mobile suit, displaying far greater performance than its opponent, the earth federation [[Heavygun]]. 

It carried the [[shot lancer]], designed to reduce the damage done to colonies with beam weaponry, along with the beam [[shield]], a powerful new defensive tool that would change warfare in the late universal century.

An unplayable [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[Futaba Sana]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

It consists of an [[aqua cardigan]] with [[gathers|gathered]] [[long sleeves]], a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[ribbon]] and [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s, a [[short dress|short]] [[yellow dress]] with [[pocket]]s and [[green bow]]s and [[striped socks|striped]] [[yellow socks|yellow]] [[kneehighs]]. She also wears a [[ring]].

Her [[medium hair|medium]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[green hair|green hair]] is [[hair down|down]], has [[blunt bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], and is decorated with a single yellow [[hairclip]].

title: high-low_dress
body:
A [[dress]] that is shorter in the front than in the back.

If dress has a straight hemline but the character is wearing a skirt the skirt leaves the front completely open and only covers the sides and rear on top of the dress use [[dress]] + [[overskirt]] instead.

[[Dress hold]], [[dress lift]] or [[side slit]] can create the illusion of a high-low dress, please be careful so as not to mistag.

h4. Examples

* !post #5377748
* !post #7905185

h4. See also

* [[High-low skirt]]
* [[Showgirl skirt]]
* [[Overskirt]]
* [[Train (clothing)]]

title: high-low_skirt
body:
A [[skirt]] that is shorter in the front than in the back.

If the skirt leaves the front completely open and only covers the sides and rear, it's a [[showgirl skirt]] instead. If the skirt isn't stand alone, but is worn on top of another skirt, shorts or pants, use [[overskirt]] instead. 

[[Skirt hold]], [[skirt lift]] or [[side slit]] can create the illusion of a high-low skirt, but isn’t one - please be careful so as not to mistag. 

h4. Examples

* !post #6871413
* !post #4236840

h4. See also

* [[High-low dress]]
* [[Showgirl skirt]]
* [[Overskirt]]
* [[Asymmetrical clothes]]
* [[Train (clothing)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: High-low skirt":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-low_skirt]

title: zendaya
body: [b]Zendaya Maree Stoermer Coleman[/b] (September 1, 1996) is an American actress and singer. Known for her roles as Rue Bennett in [[HBO]]'s Teen Drama [[Euphoria (2019)|]], [[Chani]] in Denis Villeneuve's [[Dune (series)|]] movies and famously as [[Michelle "MJ" Jones]] in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] [[Spider-man (series)|]] movies. Is currently engaged to her Spider-Man costar [[Tom Holland]], who plays as [[Peter Parker]]/[[Spider-Man]] in the MCU.

title: chani
body:
[b]Chani[/b] (pronounced /ˈtʃeɪni/) is a fictional female character featured in Frank Herbert's novels [i]Dune[/i] (1965) and Dune Messiah (1969). The character also appears in [i]Hunters of Dune[/i] (2006) and [i]Sandworms of Dune[/i] (2007), Brian Herbert and Kevin J. Anderson's novels which complete the original series.

She is portrayed by actress [[Sean Young]] in David Lynch's [i]Dune[/i] (1984), Barbora Kodetová in the 2000 miniseries [i]Frank Herbert's Dune[/i] and its 2003 sequel, [i]Frank Herbert's Children of Dune[/i] and [[Zendaya]] in Denis Villeneuve's [[dune (2021 movie)|Dune: Part One]] and [[Dune: Part Two]] movies.

Chani is a [[Fremen]].

h4. See also

* [[Dune (series)]]

title: parrying
body:
The act of blocking an enemy's weapon with your own weapon. Commonly seen in a swordfight, where at least 2 characters with swords or katanas slashing at each other to gain an advantage over the other. Sometimes it's just an improvised blocking or guarding with a weapon (sometimes your own fists).

It can also be seen in [[gameplay mechanics|game mechanics]], where parrying an opponent's attack negates all damage.

title: fallout
body:
A series of [[post-apocalypse]] role-playing games originally developed by Interplay in 1997, before being taken over by Bethesda Game Studios since 2004.

The game focuses on the events of what is left of the [[United States]] long after a global nuclear war. It takes place in a retro-futuristic alternate universe in which technology and aesthetics are reminiscent of the 1950s and satirizes the American exceptionalism characteristic of the era.

A live action television series based on the games, titled [[Fallout (prime video)|]], was released in 2024.

h4. Synopsis

After a resource war broke out over oil with China, the United States developed fusion power in an attempt to supplement its dwindling resources. However, with both sides gripped by xenophobia and paranoia, it was too late to prevent conflict, and the world was engulfed in a two-hour nuclear exchange known as "The Great War," which destroyed nearly all civilization. Around 100 years later, survivors from "Vaults"—underground shelters built to protect a small part of the population from the war—emerged to rebuild and reestablish civilization in a now desolate wasteland.

h4. Entries

She wears a [[layered dress]] consisting of a [[short dress|short]] [[blue dress|dark blue]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[backless dress|backless]] inner layer with a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[skirt under dress|skirt underneath]], and a [[white dress|white]] and [[pink dress|pink]] [[two-sided dress]] outer layer with an opening that goes [[framed breasts|around]] and [[underbust|under]] the chest area, [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s a  [[detached collar]] with a [[blue bowtie]], and a [[high-low skirt]]. She also wears a [[blue gloves|blue]] [[single bridal gauntlet]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[stirrup legwear|stirrup]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] on her left leg and an [[anklet]] on her right leg.

On March 2023, she got an update for this outfit that allows her to replace the outer dress with a [[high-waist skirt]].

title: destiny_(takt_op.)
body:
A Musicart awakened from [[Cosette Schneider]] when the latter was fatally injured during a D2 attack. Cosette thus became her host. Due to her unnatural process of becoming a Musicart, Destiny appears abnormal compared to other Musicarts, requiring [[transformation]]s between her civilian form and Musicart form.

After [spoiler]Destiny and her host body's death[/spoiler] at the end of the anime, [[Anna Schneider]] became her new host in the game, which takes place 20 years later.

Her overall appearance remains the same regardless of host. She has [[short hair|short]] to [[medium hair|medium]] [[white hair|white]]/[[grey hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[colored inner hair|inner hair]] and [[blue eyes|blue]]/[[aqua eyes]]. She wears [[red eyeshadow]], a [[crown of thorns]] with a [[red rose|red]] [[hair flower|rose]], a [[detached collar]], [[red sleeves|red]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[red dress|red]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[high-low dress]] with a [[cross-laced corset]] and [[red footwear]].

There're some physical differences due to the body change, as well as design changes.

* Cosette's version has a petite body, [[straight hair]], [[parted bangs]] and [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[sidelocks]] each with a small hair swirl at the end. She wears a dress with clean tailorings, [[bare shoulders]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[ankle boots]].

* Anna's version is taller and more mature, her hair completely curves into two large swirls on the sides of her face and is rounded at the bottom. Her collar is more elaborate and her dress is puffier with [[red rose|rose]] [[flower-trimmed dress|trim]]. She wears [[black pantyhose]] with [[high heels]].

See post #4995542 for their comparison.

title: ultimate_madoka
body:
[[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character. An alternate persona of [[Kaname Madoka]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long]] [[pink hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], tied into [[two side up]] with [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow|bows]]. She also has [[pink wings|pink]] [[wings]].

She wears a [[white choker|white]] [[choker]], a [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket|bolero]] with [[pink gemstone]]s and [[short sleeves|short]], [[wide sleeves|wide]], [[layered sleeves]]; [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], a [[high-low dress|high-low]], [[layered dress|layered]], [[white dress|white]] [[dress]] with a [[low neckline]], [[frilled dress|frills]] and a [[space print]] on the [[two-sided fabric|inner side]], along with [[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[thighhighs]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[winged footwear|winged]] [[pumps]].

[spoiler]It is the form Madoka takes in the final episode of the anime, after wishing to get rid of [[witch_(madoka_magica)|Witches]] entirely and unleashing the full power of her magic potential accumulated over multiple timelines to become an incredibly powerful, goddess-like being.[/spoiler]
Affectionately nicknamed "Madokami" or "Godoka" by fans.
other_names: アルティメットまどか

title: bronya_rand
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. 

She is the commander of the Silvermane Guards and the heir to the Supreme Guardian of Belobog. She is the adoptive daughter of [[Cocolia Rand]]. Voiced by [[Asumi Kana]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a black [[bodystocking]] worn under a [[white dress|white]] [[high-low dress]] with [[medal]]s, [[detached sleeves]], and a [[two-tone dress|blue inner color]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]], and [[earrings]]. She uses a [[rifle]] with a styled [[bayonet]] as her main weapon. 

h4. Costumes
* !post #7689969: Splash art 

h4. Profile
[expand]
Heir to the Supreme Guardian of Belobog, she is the young and capable commander of the Silvermane Guards.

Bronya received rigorous education from an early age, and possesses the grace and affinity as expected of an heir. However, after witnessing the abysmal conditions in the Underworld, seeds of doubt began growing in Belobog's future leader's mind.

"Can all the training I've received really help me lead the people to the lives they want?"
[/expand]


h4. See also
* [[Bronya Zaychik (Silverwing: N-EX)]] - Her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.

title: hanying:_zitherwoe_(pgr)
body:
The A rank Omniframe of [[Hanying (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Her Zitherwoe frame has [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[red eyes]] and dark [[green hair]], overall hair length is unknown as her hair is usually tied in an [[updo]] with [[hair stick]]s and a [[Chinese hairpin]]. Has two moles one [[mole under each eye|under each eye]], wears [[red eyeliner]] makeup, a [[single earring|single]] red [[ofuda earrings|ofuda earring]] on her left ear, and a [[gold necklace|gold]] [[pendant]] with a [[green gemstone]]/[[jade (gemstone)|]] as the centerpiece on her neck.

She wears a [[green dress|green]] and [[black dress|black]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[high-low dress]] witha [[bamboo print|print]] [[print dress|print]]) and [[side slit]]s . Wears a pair of [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]] over a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], the glove itself is also [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] with the index and thumb exposed. Wears a pair of [[white footwear|white]] and [[green footwear|green]] [[gradient footwear|gradient]] [[high heels]].

Uses a [[folding fan|folding]] [[hand fan]] as her weapon ([[Tessen]]). 

Depending on the awaken level, her dress can be green and [[white dress|white]] instead, and with [[black thighhighs|black]] [[gradient legwear|gradient thighhighs]] instead of [[bare legs]].

She has [[heterochromia]] [[purple eyes|purple]] & [[red eyes]], a [[flat chest]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[split-color hair]] that is [[purple hair|purple]] & [[red hair|red]] stylized in [[twintails]] with [[swept bangs]], as well as [[horns]]. She wears a [[heart hair ornament|heart]] [[hairclip]], [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] & [[grey ribbon|grey]] [[hair ribbon]], [[criss-cross halter]] [[off-shoulder dress|off-shoulder]] [[fur-trimmed dress|fur-trimmed]] [[high-low dress|high-low]] [[red dress]] with [[puffy sleeves|puffy]] [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[wide sleeves]], [[mismatched legwear]] consisting of a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[fur-trimmed legwear|fur-trimmed]] [[grey thighhighs|grey thighhigh]] and a [[single leg pantyhose|single]] [[black pantyhose]], as well as [[mismatched footwear]].

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[Misaki (real) (princess connect!)|Tamaizumi Misaki]] (玉泉 美咲).[/spoiler]

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this costume:

title: becky_botsford
body: The main character from the PBS Kids animated series [[WordGirl (series)|WordGirl]]. By day, she’s a seemingly ordinary fifth-grader who lives with her adoptive parents, Tim and Sally Botsford, and her little brother, TJ. In truth, Becky is secretly the crime-fighting superhero [[WordGirl (character)|WordGirl]]—an alien from the planet Lexicon who uses her extraordinary vocabulary (and super strength) to defeat villains and promote the power of language.

body:
The title character and main character in [[Imaizumin-Chi wa Douyara Gal no Tamariba ni Natteru Rashii]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] & [[brown eyes]]. He has a sexual and questionably romantic relationship with his 3 [[gyaru]] classmates: [[Hamazaki Reina|Reina]], [[Kurumizaka Ruri|Ruri]], and [[Sasaki Yukina|Yukina]].

His full name is revealed to be Imaizumi Keita during a phone call with his mother, which is "interfered with" by Yukina and Reina.

title: neuro-sama
body:
English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] entirely powered by artificial intelligence. Created by osu! streamer [[vedal987|Vedal]], she can respond to chat messages using a large language model and play video games such as [[osu!]] and [[Minecraft]]. 
Illustrated by [[anyuu|annytf]].

Her gameplaying part is written in Python, while her chatbot part is written in C#.

She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[aqua eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] light [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[two side up|two side ups]] held by [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]] and a [[heart hair ornament|heart-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. She wears a [[school uniform]]: a [[yellow cardigan]] with a [[green bowtie]] over a [[serafuku]] with [[grey sailor collar|grey]] or [[blue sailor collar]] and a [[grey skirt|grey]] or [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]]; [[uneven legwear]] with a [[black thighhighs|black]] [[single thighhigh|thighhigh]], [[black socks|black]] [[single sock|kneehigh]] and a [[bandaid on knee|bandaid on her knee]]; and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Her accessories include a [[red bag|red]] [[duffel bag|gymbag]] or [[shoulder bag]], and many [[button badge|button badges]] in the shapes of a heart, a star, a turtle, a drone and an osu! #1 badge.

h4. Costumes

title: argentinian_miku
body:
An unofficial design for [[Hatsune Miku]] as part of the [[Worldwide Miku]] trend. Has two common designs, one inspired by [[Dial Kasper]] that has her wearing the [[soccer uniform]] of the [[Argentina]] National Football Team, which features an [[Argentinian flag print]] [[print shirt|shirt]], and another inspired by [[GordaChechona]], which has her wearing a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[track jacket]], often with an [[Adidas]] logo on it. Some artists combine the two by featuring the soccer jersey under the jacket.

In January 2025, a Brazilian "tweet":[https://twitter.com/ampersand97/status/1874364856100675787] went viral on Twitter where the user in question quote-retweeted Dial Kasper's post and begged artists to depict [[Brazilian Miku]] putting [[futanari|her dick]] into Argentinian Miku. This, being a part of the longstanding rivalry between [[Brazil]] and [[Argentina]], inspiring a wave of lewd fanart between the two.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8054656: [[Dial Kasper]]
* !post #8074759: [[GordaChechona]]

h4. See also

* [[Brazilian Miku]]
* [[Worldwide Miku]]

title: expressive_hair
body:
Hair that is an extension of expressing certain emotion, such as excitement or depression. Signified by flapping, lowering, or (in the case of an [[ahoge]]) forming a [[heart ahoge]].

Not to be confused with [[prehensile hair]], when hair is being actively used as a ligament, tool or weapon.

h4. See also

* [[ahoge wag]]

title: helicopter_tail
body:
A [[tail]] that appears to operate like the rotors of a [[helicopter]].

h4. See also

* [[helicopter hair]]

title: zongzi
body:
Chinese [[dumpling]]s made of glutinous rice and wrapped in bamboo leaves, may or may not have a filling. It has various regional names and recipes, both sweet and salty ones exist.

Enjoyed on the traditional Chinese holiday [[Dragon Boat Festival]] on May 5th of the Lunar calendar.

Its Japanese version is called ちまき ([i]chimaki[/i]) and eaten on Japan's [[Kodomo no Hi]] on May 5th. 

h4. See also 

* [[Chinese food]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]] 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Zongzi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zongzi

title: koinobori
body:
[[Koi]]-shaped [[windsock]]s used as part of celebrations on [[Kodomo no Hi]] (Japanese Children's Day), a Japanese national holiday held annually on May 5th.

h4. See also

* [[koi]]
* [[carp]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Koinobori":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koinobori]

title: kashiwa_mochi_(food)
body:
A type of [[mochi]]. Rice cakes, usually filled with [[red bean paste]], wrapped in oak leaves, eaten on [[Kodomo no Hi]] (Japan's Children's Day on May 5th).

h4.See also

* [[zongzi]]
* [[koinobori]]
* [[sakura mochi]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: ayanami_(kancolle)
body: The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ayanami[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. 11th of the Special Types, 1st of her own class. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]]. She and [[shikinami (kancolle)|Shikinami]] wear a brown version of the Fubuki-class [[serafuku]]. On her second remodel, her uniform becomes black with red stripes on white and she gains a searchlight. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[side_ponytail|sidetail]]. Said sidetail becomes as long as she is tall once in her [[Ayanami Kai Ni (kancolle)|second remodel]]. This sometimes leads to references to [[Gon-san]]. h4. Skins * !asset #22669225: Default * !post #3226202: [[Ayanami Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] * !post #2804882: [[ayanami_(yukata_mode)_(kancolle)|Summer 2017]] h4. History She is termed the "demon goddess" of the Third Torpedo Squadron (DesRon3) due to her performance in the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal, where she alone formed one 'prong' of a three-pronged attack. She assisted in the sinking of three destroyers (heavily damaging a fourth) and traded fire with [[South Dakota (Kancolle)|]] before she was severely damaged and sunk by [[Washington (Kancolle)|]]. h4. [i]Ayanami[/i]-class destroyers * [b]Ayanami[/b] * [[Shikinami (Kancolle)|]] * Asagiri (Yet to be implemented) * Yuugiri (Yet to be implemented) * [[Amagiri (Kancolle)|]] * [[Sagiri (Kancolle)|]] * [[Oboro (Kancolle)|]] * [[Akebono (Kancolle)|]] * [[Sazanami (Kancolle)|]] * [[Ushio (Kancolle)|]] h4. See also * [[Ayanami (Azur Lane)]] * [[Ayanami (Warship Girls R)]] * [[Ayanami (Blue Oath)]] * [[Ayanami (Black Surge Night)]] h4. External links * "Kancolle Wiki: Ayanami":https://en.kancollewiki.net/Ayanami * "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Ayanami[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Ayanami_(1929)]
other_names: 綾波(艦隊これくしょん)

title: shachihoko
body:
A [b]Shachihoko[/b] is a mythical animal from Japanese folklore with the head of a [[tiger]]/[[dragon]] and body of a [[fish]].  Shachihoko were said to be able to bring rain and grant protection from fire.  For this reason, statues of shachihoko feature prominently on the rooftops of various castles, temples and other major buildings made of wood.

They may have evolved from a similar mythical Chinese animal called the [b]Chiwen[/b].

h4. See also
* [[chimera]]
* [[Rainmaker (Splatoon)]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Shachihoko":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shachihoko]

title: chinese_track_school_uniform
body:
First introduced in the 1990s, mainland China uses a track suit style school uniform. It is not literally for gym or track, but an all purpose school uniform used during all subjects. Usually blue and white in color and has a polo shirt underneath. 

The track suit is usually quite baggy and are unisex, both male and female students wear the same uniforms. They are regarded by many Chinese students as unattractive, but are often fawned over by students of other countries for their comfort.

title: diploma_tube
body: A protective tube for [[diploma]]s and certificates.  A common item in [[graduation]] images.

title: meme
body:
A meme is a concept of any sorts (image, video, song, etc.) that spreads from person to person (through the Internet, popular culture, etc.) within a culture, to the point that it becomes part of that culture, acting in a way as the cultural analogue to genes (at least, in the more traditional sense of memes, not the current usage). 

This tag is automatically added along with any tag with a name ending with "*_(meme)":[/tags?&search%5Bname_matches%5D=%2A_%28meme%29&search%5Border%5D=count]. When creating a new meme tag, make sure to follow this format.

h4. See also

* [[meme attire]]
* [[neta]] (Japanese net slang for meme, roughly; used here for lesser-known Japanese memes)
other_names: インターネットミーム

title: duramente_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]In musical terminology, denotes a passage marked to be played in a bold and firm style. From Italian: "Roughly, coarsely, harshly".[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by King Kamehameha and foaled by Admire Groove (a daughter of [[Air Groove (racehorse)|]]), Duramente was a racehorse with an exceptional record (9: 5-4-0, 2 G1 wins) but his career was cut short due to injuries. He was [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]]'s major rival during their classics.

However, what makes him most exceptional is the quality of his offspring. Despite dying unexpectedly due to colitis on August 31, 2021 (he was aged 9) and thus, only having a few years worth of crops, his legacy is already set, thanks to [[Titleholder (racehorse)|]], [[Stars on Earth (racehorse)|]] and [[Liberty Island (racehorse)|]] (assuming they actually survive to stud).

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], the game had to settle with a stand-in NPC ([[Brusquement (Umamusume)|]]) until they could finally score Shadai Group horses, thus finally paving the way for [[Duramente (umamusume)|the real deal]] in Season 3 of the anime.

h5.G1 Winners:

* [[Titleholder (racehorse)|]]: 2021 Kikuka Sho, 2022 Spring Tenno Sho; Takarazuka Kinen
* [[Stars on Earth (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Oka Sho; Oaks
* [[Valle de la Luna (racehorse)|]]: 2022 JBC Ladies'Classic (Jpn1); 2023 Kashiwa Kinen (Jpn1)
* [[Dura Erede (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Hopeful Stakes (Active)
* [[Liberty Island (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Hanshin Juvenile Fillies; 2023 Triple Tiara (Oka Sho, Oaks and Shuka Sho) (Active)
* [[Champagne Color (racehorse)|]]: 2023 NHK Mile Cup (Active)
* [[Durezza (racehorse)|]]: 2023 Kikuka Sho (Active)
* Icon Tailor: 2022 JBC Ladies'Classic (Jpn1)
* Lugal: 2024 Sprinters Stakes (Active)

title: shibafu_(glock23)_(style)
body:
(Japanese nickname: Shibafu-mura, "Shibafu Village")
(English nicknames: Potato, Potato face, Potato curse, Potato style, Shibafutatoes)

[[Style parody]] of the artist [[Shibafu (glock23)]]. He is infamous among [[Kantai Collection]] fans for using a [[same face|very similar face for all of the shipgirls drawn by him]], such as Akagi, Kasuga Maru, Ooi, and Fubuki. This style involves a squarish face with round cheeks, [[tareme]] eyes (typically; [[Kaga (kancolle)|]] is a notable exception), and a small nose and mouth. For extra effect, the same shading techniques used by Shibafu can be used. The shape of the faces is often compared to a potato, hence the nicknames.

A common gag is the Shibafu Village, where characters drawn by Shibafu grow potatoes, which are sometimes depicted as having the power to change one's drawing style into Shibafu's, face and all.

h4. Examples

* !post #2534856: [[Warspite (kancolle)|]] in "Potato" style. 
* !post #2452301: [[Warspite (kancolle)|]] in her official style as a reference. 

Please do not use this tag in art actually drawn by Shibafu.

title: it's_all_fucking_lewds_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] depicting a character [[egosearching|looking up themselves on the Internet]] and discovering that most or all of their public-accessible portrayals consist of [[pornography]], exclaiming as much to the viewer or to another character.

Such pornography need not actually be visible in the image, nor need the image necessarily qualify for the [[Rule 34 (meme)|]] tag or Pool #730.

Originated with Post #2651791 (though the translation has since been edited for further accuracy).

title: danganronpa:_trigger_happy_havoc
body:
A video game/visual novel published in 2010 for the PlayStation Portable by Spike. The game has often been described as a mix between [[Ace Attorney]] and [[Battle Royale]].

A sequel, [[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]], was published in 2012.

Received an anime adaptation in 2013.

title: souryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Souryuu[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] dark [[blue hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit, fitting of her name ("[[Seiryuu|Azure Dragon]]"), consists of a [[green kimono]] top with [[wide sleeves]], dark [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], dragon horn-themed [[hairclip]]s for her twintails, flight deck apron, [[white socks]], [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[sandals]], and [[yugake]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[quiver]] with a radio mast to her back, and her real-life [[flight deck]] on her right arm. 

She, along with Hiryuu and [[unryuu (kancolle)|Unryuu]], have been nicknamed the "fluffy dragons" because of their generally soft and womanly appearance, in part to their considerably large breasts, and the fact that the "-ryuu" in their names translate to "Dragon".

title: hiryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Hiryuu[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. As she was initially designed as Souryuu's sister, she shares the same kimono-and-skirt outfit, but with a different color: hers is [[yellow kimono|yellow]] and [[green skirt|green]]. Common attributes are the [[wide sleeves]], [[white socks]], [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[sandals]], [[yugake]], and flight deck apron with her hull identifier "Hi" inscribed. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[quiver]] to her back and her real-life [[flight deck]] to her left arm.

title: ishigaki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Ishigaki[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a pair of [[hair ribbon]]s, and [[purple eyes]]. Her default (and only) outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]], [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[green jacket]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, two hull pieces each containing a 12 cm single gun mount and 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and [[depth charge]]s on her ankles.

title: hachijou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Hachijou[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] tied by [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s, and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]], [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[green jacket]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, two hull pieces each containing a 12 cm single gun mount and 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and [[depth charge]]s on her ankles. 

The historical [i]IJN Hachijou[/i] was commissioned in late March 1941, mostly patrolling the northern waters of Japan and escorted convoys. She survived an air attack in July 1944 and went on to survive the war, although she was scrapped in 1948 apparently having sat idle by that time.

title: kunashiri_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Kunashiri[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sasaki Hitomi]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[pink hair]] with [[brown hair|brown]] [[colored tips|tips]] done [[two side up]], and [[orange eyes]]. Her default (and only) outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]], [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[green jacket]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, two hull pieces each containing a 12 cm single gun mount and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and [[depth charge]]s on her ankles. 

Sometimes paired with [[Nenohi (kancolle)|]] due to a faux pas that happened when Kunashiri served as a diplomatic escort for the envoy to Russia. She is named after "Kunashir Island":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunashir_Island ([i]Kunashiri[/i] in Japanese), the southernmost of the Kuril Islands between Hokkaido and Kamchatka and one of four in territorial dispute by Japan and Russia.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2711039

title: hoshimachi_suisei_(spectra_of_nova)
body:
The 9th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Hoshimachi Suisei]]. It was first revealed during her solo 3D live tour "[i]Spectra of Nova[/i]", including her 3D live show "[i]SuperNova[/i]".

In this costume she wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt tucked in|tucked in shirt]] with [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].
For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], she has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] done in a [[bob cut]]-style.

body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Shimushu[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sasaki Hitomi]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]], [[messy hair|messy]], [[grey hair]] with [[bangs]], and [[green eyes]] drawn in [[tareme]] style. Her default (and only) outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]], [[fur-trimmed jacket|fur-trimmed]] [[green jacket]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, two hull pieces each containing a 12 cm single gun mount and 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and [[depth charge]]s on her ankles. 

She is named after "Shumshu Island":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shumshu], the second-northernmost of the Kuril Islands.

title: love_live!
body:
A Japanese multimedia franchise by [[Bushiroad]] in collaboration with [[Sunrise (company)|]], revolving around groups of fictional high school girls who become idols to compete in the titular national school idol tournament.

It is notable for being one of the first to link the fictional idol character with the [[real life]] semi-idol group consisting of a newly recruited [[voice actor|voice actress]] specifically for the character (with the exception of some members of the first installment who already had an existing voice acting and music career). This format would later be replicated by its sister franchise [[BanG Dream!]], which is fully managed by Bushiroad themselves.

h4. Series

* [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]
* [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]

Her default outfit, the [i]Matsu[/i]-class uniform, is composed of a [[brown shirt|khaki]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[grey sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black corset]] (with an [[anchor]] [[zipper pull tab]]), [[grey_skirt|gray]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]].

title: momo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Momo[/i]. Character design by [[Watanabe Akio]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[green_hair|green]] [[gradient hair|gradient end]] tied into [[twintails]] with an [[ahoge]], [[red eyes]], and a [[fang]]. Her default outfit, the [i]Matsu[/i]-class uniform, is composed of a [[brown shirt|khaki]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[grey sailor collar]], [[green neckerchief]], [[black corset]] (with an [[anchor]] [[zipper pull tab]]), [[grey_skirt|gray]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], [[black gloves]], [[black choker]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast (with [[radar]]) to her back, 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the rig, a 12.7 cm single [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her right leg, and [[depth charge]]s on her left leg.

Upon her introduction into the game, Momo was mistaken to be a pink-haired [[Matsushima Michiru]] of the [i][[grisaia_(series)|Grisaia]][/i] series, another title her illustrator was involved in.

Considers herself as the fleet's newest [[idol]], but the game's preexisting idol [[Naka (kancolle)|]] does not mind having her around. Considering this, some artists already have the two together side by side and coexisting, but others could not help but depict the latter as the stereotypical insecure idol wary of newcomers eating at their fanbase.

title: help:tags
body:
Tags are keywords used to describe [[help:posts|posts]], allowing you to easily search and explore posts based on their content. Consult the [[help:cheatsheet|cheat sheet]] for a full guide on searching posts. See the [[tag groups]] for existing tags.

h4. Tagging guidelines

When you're tagging a post, use the following guidelines:

h6. Replace spaces with underscores

For example, [code]maria-sama ga miteru[/code] becomes [code]maria-sama_ga_miteru[/code]. Spaces are used to separate tags.

h6. Character names

This is somewhat complicated. In general, use whatever order the source material uses. Failing this, use the ordering the character's nationality suggests. This typically means LastName FirstName order for Asian names, and FirstName LastName order for Western names.

But there are exceptions. Some characters use FirstName LastName order despite having Asian-sounding names. [[Subaru Nakajima]] is a good example of this (in all official promotional artwork FirstName LastName order is used). There is nothing we can do but shake our heads.

Some characters have a mixture of Asian and Western names. Refer to the source material for these cases. Failing that, the general rule is, use whatever ordering the character's last name suggests. Asuka Langley Souryuu has a Japanese last name, so it would become [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]]. Akira Ferrari has an Italian last name, so it becomes [[Akira Ferrari]]. But again, there are exceptions to this, like [[Setsuna F. Seiei]].

h6. Full Names

Using full names reduces the chances of collisions.

h6#restrictions. Tag name restrictions

* Must not be blank, i.e. must contain at least one character
* Cannot contain any asterisks ( * ) or commas ( , )
* Cannot begin with a tilde ( ~ ) or dash ( - )
* Cannot begin or end with an underscore ( _ ), or contain consecutive underscores
* Must contain only printable characters
** [code]!"#$%&'()+-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\]^_`abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz{|}~[/code]
* Cannot begin with a metatag and ":"
** Example: [code]pool:test[/code]
** See "List of available metatags":[/wiki_pages/help:cheatsheet.html#dtext-n4]
* "new" and "search" are reserved and cannot be used
* [b]*_(cosplay)[/b] tags must have an existing character tag
** E.g. [b]chen_(cosplay)[/b] must have a [b]chen[/b] tag

h6. Ask

If you're not sure whether a tag is right or wrong, then ask for help in topic #12251 ("How do I tag this?").

h4. Tag categories

There are five types of tags: artist, character, copyright, general, and meta. Artist tags are red, characters are green, copyrights are purple, general tags are blue, and meta tags are orange.

h6. Artist

Artist tags identify the creator of a post. This doesn't mean the creator of the original copyrighted artwork. For example, you wouldn't use the [[Barasui]] tag on a picture of [[Matsuoka Miu]] drawn by [[Naruko Hanaharu]].

Artist names should follow the guidelines in [[howto:romanize]]. Ask in topic #8199 ("Artist tagging help") if you need help creating an artist tag.

h6. Character

Character tags identify the characters in the post. Remember that Danbooru uses LastName_FirstName ordering.

h6. Copyright

Copyright tags identify the anime, manga, game, or novel that the post is associated with. More generally, copyright tags identify the source material that the characters are from.

Copyright tags should not be used for trademarks or brand names. A rule of thumb: if something doesn't have characters, it probably shouldn't be a copyright tag.

h6. [[help:metatags|Meta]]

Meta tags generally describe things beyond the content of the image itself. Examples include [[translated]], [[copyright request]], [[duplicate]], [[image sample]], and [[bad id]].

h6. General

General tags are used for everything else. General tags should objectively describe the contents of the post. Don't use [[tag group:subjective|subjective tags]] which can be biased by personal preferences (e.g. [[cute]] or [[sexy]]), and don't tag things based on outside knowledge rather than what one can see in the post.

h6#changing-tag-categories. Changing tag categories

You can change the category of the tag by prefixing it with [code]artist:[/code], [code]character:[/code], [code]copyright:[/code], [code]meta:[/code], or [code]general:[/code] when tagging a post. For example, tagging a post with [code]artist:sakura[/code] would change the [[sakura]] tag to an artist tag.

 [code]art:[/code], [code]char:[/code], [code]copy:[/code] are shortcuts for these prefixes.

You can also search the "Tags":[/tags] listing and use the "edit" link next to the tag to change its category.

Tags with between 50 and 1000 posts can only have their category changed by Builders. Category changes for above 1000 posts can be done by Admins, though any large changes should be discussed on the forum first. Make a "bulk update request":/bulk_update_requests/new to create a forum topic requesting that a tag category be changed.

h4. See also

* [[howto:tag|How to Tag]]
* [[help:translated_tags|]]
* [[help:tag_aliases]]
* [[help:tag_implications]]

title: fuyutsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Fuyutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] done [[one side up]] with a [[hachimaki]] and fire control director, and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit, while still based on the original [i]Akizuki-class[/i] template, diverges somewhat from her elder sisters'. It comprises a [[white shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[grey coat]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[grey necktie]], [[black gloves]], [[grey corset]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[grey thighhighs|grey]] checkered [[argyle thighhighs]], and grey [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her gear is mostly identical to the rest of the [i]Akizuki-class[/i] except that the bow part is straight and only the exterior is clad, showing off the interior skeleton. She has her own pair of [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (fuyutsuki's)|]]. They are missing their flipper arms, are covered in scars and their eyes are closed, only being opened in her damaged CG, where their eyes are shown to be white on black, with a central pupil and glint design.

title: nenohi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Nenohi[/i]. Character design by [[Ayaki]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] in a [[single braid]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with Hatsuharu on historical grounds, consists of a [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black bodysuit]], [[bike shorts]], [[bandaged leg|bandages]] as improvised socks, and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge to her back, 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on joints attached to the bridge, 12.7 single and twin [[handgun]] mounts, and floating [[headgear]]. 

A very energetic girl, she tends to use her name in a joke. In fact, it's her single gag, characteristic catchphrase and verbal tic in one ("What day is today? Nenohi/New Year's Day!").

h4. Skins

* !post #2082842: Base
* !post #2229892: [[Nenohi (New Year) (Kancolle)|New Year]]

h4. History

The second of the [i]Hatsuharu[/i]-class built, [i]Nenohi[/i] was actually the first launched. Commissioned on the same day as her sister on 30 September 1933, their trials and initial operations revealed severe stability and maneuverability problems arising from IJN specifications to have them carry identical armament to the larger [i]Fubuki[/i]-class on a lighter displacement. These problems forced the pair into a refit that saw their tall bridges, funnels, and masts lowered while one of their three triple torpedo mounts was removed.

At the start of the war, she was assigned with her sisters as Destroyer Division 21 and saw action in the Dutch East Indies and Aleutian campaigns, the latter was where she was sunk by a US submarine on 4 July 1942, with [[Inazuma (Kancolle)|]] rescuing her survivors.

body:

For creatures with external skeletons, see the [[carapace]] tag.

Skeletons animated by magic or supernatural forces should also be tagged [[undead]].

If the skeleton is from an animal or non-humanoid creature in general use [[animal skeleton]].

title: hatsushimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hatsushimo[/i]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|Yadokari]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] [[low-tied_long_hair|tied low]] and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Wakaba on historical grounds, consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black jacket]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm single handgun mount on her left, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount on her right, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on the sides of her waist. 

Despite her record as one of the few surviving ships from [[Operation Ten-Gou]] (and the only one who was undamaged), she is also the very last major warship sunk in action during the war. The circumstances of her sinking and the genericness of her design has turned her into the most inconspicuous shipgirl of the game before her second remodel.

title: natsugumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Natsugumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Fujikawa-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[plaid bowtie|plaid]] [[yellow bowtie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, funnel, and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]], [[depth charge]]s dangling from her left suspender, and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her right leg [[thigh strap]]. 

h4. Skins

* !post #5622905: Base

title: yuugure_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yuugure[/i]. Character designed by [[Allenes]], voiced by Asahina Madoka. 

Her base form portrays her with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[cat ears]] (and matching [[cat tail]]), tied [[two side up]]. She wears a white [[serafuku]] with [[black sailor collar]], a [[black skirt]], a pink print coat, red [[wristband|wristbands]] with [[jingle bell|jingle bells]], and white [[thighhighs]]. Her [[rigging]] at base form is minimal, only possessing a 61 cm triple torpedo mount to her back, reload torpedoes tucked in her coat, and a 12.7 cm twin mount Type B as a [[handgun]].

title: ariake_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ariake[/i]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] dark [[purple hair]] with an [[orange_hair|orange]] [[gradient_hair|gradient end]], tied into a [[low ponytail]] with [[bangs]] and [[hair_over_one_eye|covering her left eye]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sister Yuugure: a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]], a [[white shirt|white undershirt]] paired with a [[double-breasted]] [[black shirt|black]] [[dress shirt]], [[black jacket]], [[grey skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is composed of her funnel and foremast to her back with 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on the sides, a 12.7 twin [[handgun]] mount, and [[depth charge]]s on her left [[thigh strap]].

title: michishio_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Michishio[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] light [[brown hair]] done [[two side up]] into [[double bun]]s, and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]].

The historical ship was completed in October 1937 and sunk at Battle of Surigao Strait in October 1944.

title: the_thing
body:
Three film adaptations of "John W. Campbell Jr.'s":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._Campbell [[science fiction]] short novel, "'Who Goes There?'":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Who_Goes_There%3F 
The most renowned one is "the second adaptation by John Carpenter.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_%281982_film%29 
The Japanese translation of the word "Thing" is 物体X ([i]Buttai X[/i], lit. "Thing-X") 

For the Marvel superhero known as The Thing, see [[Ben Grimm]].

h4.List of titles 

* "Who Goes There?":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Who_Goes_There%3F 
** Japanese title: "影が行く":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%BD%B1%E3%81%8C%E8%A1%8C%E3%81%8F 
* "The Thing from Another World":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_from_Another_World 
** Japanese title: "遊星よりの物体X":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%81%8A%E6%98%9F%E3%82%88%E3%82%8A%E3%81%AE%E7%89%A9%E4%BD%93X 
* "(John Carpenter's) The Thing":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_%281982_film%29 
** Japanese title: "遊星からの物体X":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%81%8A%E6%98%9F%E3%81%8B%E3%82%89%E3%81%AE%E7%89%A9%E4%BD%93X 
* "The Thing (2011)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_%282011_film%29 
** Japanese title: "遊星からの物体X ファーストコンタクト":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%81%8A%E6%98%9F%E3%81%8B%E3%82%89%E3%81%AE%E7%89%A9%E4%BD%93X_%E3%83%95%E3%82%A1%E3%83%BC%E3%82%B9%E3%83%88%E3%82%B3%E3%83%B3%E3%82%BF%E3%82%AF%E3%83%88 
* "The Thing (video game)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Thing_%28video_game%29 
** Japanese title: "遊星からの物体X episodeII":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%81%8A%E6%98%9F%E3%81%8B%E3%82%89%E3%81%AE%E7%89%A9%E4%BD%93X_episodeII 
* "The Things":[http://clarkesworldmagazine.com/watts_01_10/] (Spin-off short story by Peter Watts)
** Japanese title: 遊星からの物体Xの回想

h4.External Links

title: lynette_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]].

A young magician who is part of the House of the Hearth with her twin brother, [[Lyney_(genshin_impact)|]], and her adoptive brother [[Freminet_(genshin_impact)|]].

As kids, she and Lyney lived on the streets and did magic tricks to get money, but one day they were adopted by an aristocrat involved in human trafficking, who planned to sell off Lynette. They were rescued by [[Arlecchino_(genshin_impact)|]] and joined the House of the Hearth, thus becoming Fatui spies.

* !post #6458774: Official Artwork

title: kenkou_ni_yoku_nai!_(bang_dream!)
body:
Scene from episode 4 of [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!|BanG Dream! Ave Mujica]], where [[Wakaba Mutsumi]]'s alternate personality [[Mortis (Bang Dream!)|]] says the line, 「健康によくない！」("[i]Kenkou ni yoku nai![/i]", translated as "It's not good for her health!") about [[Togawa Sakiko]]'s sleeping habits to [[Misumi Uika]] while making an [[x fingers]] gesture. This gesture appears similar to one made by [[Nagasaki Soyo]] during episode 3 of [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!]].

title: cleveland_(road_trip!)_(azur_lane)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Cleveland (azur lane)]], added exclusively to English version as part of the first anniversary celebrations.

In this costume, she wears a [[white coat]] with [[American flag]]-style decorations on the shoulders over a [[blue shirt]] with the partially obscured phrase "Charlie Love Five Five" (i.e. CL-55, Cleveland's hull number). [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black]] [[torn thighhighs|torn thighhigh]], with [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]] and a [[white hat|white]] [[visor cap]]. The skin also features a [[scooter]] with American flag-style markings, a [[fire hydrant]], some [[traffic cone]]s, and several [[road sign]]s including a [[stop sign]], a [[speed limit sign]] and a sign featuring Cleveland's 13 battle stars.

h4. Appearance

She is a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] [[elf]] with [[pointy ears]], [[long hair|long]], [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[blonde hair]], often kept in a [[high ponytail]] held with a [[hair bow]] and [[sidelocks]]. She also has [[large breasts]] that while she downplays them with most of her costumes, are actually larger than [[Houshou Marine|Marine]]'s.

title: yuzuki_choco
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[2nd generation (hololive)|]]. A school doctor at a Makai school. She is a [[demon girl]] who looks like a succubus but isn't one. Designed by [[Masuishi Kinoto]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], [[green eyes|green]]/[[aqua eyes]], [[pointy ears]] and [[large breasts]] with a [[winged heart]] [[winged heart tattoo|tattoo]] on her [[breast tattoo|left breast]]. Being a demon, she also has [[black horns|black]] [[demon horns]] with [[horn ring|ring]]s on her left horn, [[demon wings|wings]], and a [[demon tail]].

Her default hairstyle consists of [[swept bangs]] and a [[single sidelock]] with a [[tress ribbon]].

title: anya_melfissa
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Holoro|2nd Generation]]. Designed by [[Uekura Eku]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with a [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] and [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[purple eyes]] in a semi-permanent [[jitome]] with [[no pupils]] and [[short eyebrows]].

Her regular hairstyle with her default costume is a [[two side up]] with [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[center-flap bangs]] with [[drill sidelocks]] and decorated with a kris-shaped [[hairclip]].

While her reference sheet (and later, her 3D model) portray her with [[small breasts]] bordering on a [[flat chest]], the perspective on her default 2D model gives the impression of her having [[large breasts]]. Because of this, her bust size (and her maturity, to some extent) in fanart varies greatly based on each artist's interpretation.

body:

Also known as her "street" or "outing" outfit from [i]hololive Closet[/i], it consists of a [[black headwear|black]] [[sailor hat]], a [[black choker|black]] [[pendant choker|choker]] with a [[pendant]], a [[short dress|short]] [[grey dress|grey]] [[vertical-striped dress|vertical-striped]] [[pinstripe dress|pinstripe]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]] worn over a [[black dress]] and a [[black jacket]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]]. She also comes an assortment of [[glasses|eyeglasses]]. A later update gave her [[cat ears]] and elongated [[headphones]] to cover her entire ears. This outfit has the particularity of matching both with Noel's [[Shirogane Noel (casual)|casual]] costume and Fubuki's [[Shirakami Fubuki (aristocrat Kei)|lolita librarian]] costume.

title: houshou_marine_(summer)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]]. 

It consists of a [[red bikini|red]] [[string bikini]] [[halterneck]] [[bikini under clothes|worn under]] a [[black jacket|black]], [[partially unzipped]] [[hooded jacket]] [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts|short]]  [[dolphin shorts]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]], an [[ankle strap]] [[gladiator sandals]], a [[black headwear|black]] [[baseball cap]] and [[heart-shaped eyewear|heart-shaped]] [[sunglasses]]. A week after her third outfit debut, Marine revealed a variant with unzipped jacket, a [[wet]] [[see-through shirt|see-through]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]]. This was actually a compromise to comply with Youtube's guidelines.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

* [[Very long hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]]
* Very long hair tied in [[twintails]] held with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s
* Very long [[straight hair]] with [[sidelocks]]

body:

It is a [[gothic lolita]] costume consisting of a [[black headwear|black]] [[mini top hat]] with [[hat flower|flowers]], a [[red dress|red]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[short dress]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[long sleeves|long]] [[red sleeves|red]] [[frilled sleeves]], a [[black bowtie]], a [[heart necklace]], the same leotard as her default costume, [[black gloves]], an [[underbust]] [[corset]], a [[pocket watch]], [[white thighhighs]] with a [[white garter belt|white]] [[garter belt]], a [[leg ribbon]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]] with [[high heels]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Very long hair]] tied in [[twin drills|twin]] [[ringlets]] held with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s and [[sidelocks]]

title: houshou_marine_(businesswoman)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]], unveiled on April 1, 2023. 

Adopting a CEO/shachou theme (and aptly named her "businesswoman" or "OL" outfit in [i]hololive Closet[/i]), it consists of a [[partially unbuttoned]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], an [[ID card]] with a red [[lanyard]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[miniskirt]] with [[side slit]]s and [[double-breasted]] [[buttons]], [[bodystocking]], [[pantyhose]], and a [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] dark [[blue coat]]. 

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[very long hair]] cut [[short hair|short]] in a [[bob cut]].

body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shirogane Noel]].

Her casual attire consists of a [[white sweater|white]], [[ribbed sweater|ribbed]] [[off-shoulder sweater]] worn over a [[black tank top]], a [[black choker]] with a [[snowflake pendant|snowflake]] [[pendant]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]], [[brown skirt|brown]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

In June 1st 2021, she received a variation of her casual attire as a joke for the "World Milk Day":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Milk_Day], which adds a cow [[cow ears|ears]], [[cow horns|horns]] and a [[cow tail|tail]], a [[collared shirt]] with a [[cow print]] and a [[neck bell|neck]] [[cowbell]]. This peculiar attire is a result of Noel embracing all the "cow jokes" resulting from her large breasts.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume one for the regular version and one for the World Milk Day variation:

body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], designed by [[moenaomii (artist)|moenaomii]]. 

Started streaming in December 2022, though his current outfit debuted on January 2025.

A perpetually [[bags under eyes|tired]] and overworked [[demon]] with a [[otoko no ko|feminine appearance]]. Works as an intern for a questionable company at very late hours.

Wears an [[off shoulder]] [[oversized clothes|oversized]] [[lab coat]] that [[sleeves past fingers|goes past his hands]], along with a [[turtleneck sweater]] and [[bike shorts|spats]]. title: braw_bro
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.  

[b]MAN-03 Braw Bro[/b]

The first [[mobile armor]] designed by the Principality of [[Zeon]] to be used exclusively by newtypes. Created by Zeon's "Flanagan Institute", it has the distinction of being the first mobile weapon to be equipped with the psychic communicator "Psycommu" system for piloting the MA and controlling the only weapons that the Braw Bro was equipped with: four wire-guided units mounting two barrel mega particle guns (top and bottom spars) or single mega particle guns (starboard and port spars). 

The Braw Bro was also designed to separate into different blocks, so that any test data could be preserved.

title: dark_knight_(eversoul)
body:
A non-playable Humanlike Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Pyo Yeong-jae (Korean) | Uncredited (Japanese)
[hr]
A rare male Soul, he is a mysterious armor-clad Soul with a deep hatred towards his fellow Souls and especially towards the [[Savior_(eversoul)|]]. He's currently in service of Kayrin Faust, the human Soul Master seeking to end the lives of the Souls and restart humanity's dominance on the Earth they once left behind. It's eventually revealed that [spoiler]his name is Adam, the very first Soul that Dr. Angelica Faust gave physical form and one of two primordial Souls created by the Transcendents to watch over and ensure the world's eternal recurrence alongside his "sibling" [[Eve_(eversoul)|]]. The reason behind the rarity of male Souls is because of Faust reluctantly having to disgrace Adam as a defective Soul as she couldn't find a way to forge data that would obfuscate Adam's innate affinity towards combat. Despite simply delaying the inevitable, Adam accepted his role to be in the shadows, watching over humanity right behind Faust and Eve in its last few years[/spoiler].

His associated Artifact is currently unknown.

title: daphne_(eversoul)
body:
A Fairy-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Yu Yeong (Korean) | [[Iwami Manaka]] (Japanese)
[hr]
Once a statuesque yet simple country bumpkin, she went to Arkenine to work as a blacksmith after the [[Savior_(eversoul)|]] and his retinue once went to her village and saved it from a minor Gate incident. Wanting to be of use to the Savior and his cause, she decided to use her uncanny superhuman strength to both create strong weapons for Solrey's knights and to fight against monsters and protect her allies while wielding her massive warhammer.

Her associated Artifact is [i]"Hephaestus's Hammer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hephaestus][/i].

title: tokoyami_towa
body:

She has multiple [[spike piercing|spike]] and hoop [[ear piercing]]s on both ears with also an [[earclip]] on her right ear and an [[industrial piercing]] on her left ear, she also has a [[navel piercing]] and even some [[tail piercing|piercings on her tail]]. She wears a [[black hat|black]] [[horned headwear|horned]] [[baseball cap]] with an OwO face, which is actually her pet and mascot [[Bibi (tokoyami towa)|]].

title: atago_(kancolle)
body:

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Takao on historical grounds, comprises a [[blue hat|blue]] [[beret]], [[blue shirt|blue]] [[dress shirt]], [[white ascot]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], [[black gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bridge and funnels wrapped around her waist, and a circular half-rig hull containing three 20.3 cm twin gun mounts.

Her trademark catchphrase is shouting "[[pan-pa-ka-paaan!]]" when changing equipment. She also uses this as her unique greeting in the anime.
