title: help:upload
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Danbooru Quality: Posting Guidelines":[#dtext-danbooru-quality-posting-guidelines]
** "Rules":[#dtext-rules]
** "Err on The Side of Caution":[#dtext-err-on-the-side-of-caution]
** "Danbooru is Subjective":[#dtext-danbooru-is-subjective]
* "Uploading":[#dtext-uploading]
** "Source Your Upload":[#dtext-source-your-upload]
** "Minimal Tagging Criteria":[#dtext-minimal-tagging-criteria]
** "Make Use of Comments, Discord and the Forum":[#dtext-make-use-of-comments-and-the-forum]
** "Check for Duplicates":[#dtext-check-for-duplicates]
* "See Also":[#dtext-see-also]
[/expand]

h4#danbooru_quality_posting_guidelines. Danbooru Quality: Posting Guidelines

Thank you for donating your spare time to help the Danbooru collection grow. While we need a constant supply of new images to keep our collection fresh and up to date, we must make it clear that Danbooru has stricter quality standards compared to most galleries of its kind.

Before you upload your first image, please keep in mind that not everything you upload might be approved. 
While we understand that quality can be an extremely subjective measure, and we cannot exactly define what "good enough" means, you can browse the gallery of approved posts to get an idea of what is acceptable. You can see those posts here: {{status:active approver:any}}. 
Generally, posts with [[bad anatomy]] or a lot of [[JPEG artifacts]], or very [[lowres|low resolution]] will have a hard time getting approved, while competently drawn images will be approved fairly quickly. 
Posts depicting very niche fetishes like [[inflation]] might also have a hard time, because they appeal to very few users, so the bar for that kind of post might be higher than average.

The upload rules (see below) go into detail on what is considered risky content. Refer to that page for more info.


h5#rules. READ THE "UPLOAD RULES":/help/upload_rules BEFORE PROCEEDING

The rules describe what is forbidden and what is conditionally accepted. Please read them before you upload.


h5#err_on_the_side_of_caution. Err on The Side of Caution

If unsure about an image meeting our quality standards, you can ask in the "Official Discord":https://discord.gg/danbooru.

h5#danbooru_is_subjective. Danbooru is Subjective

We know that it can seem unfair at times that we judge images on quality, which is of course a subjective value. But we do this because this method works for Danbooru and pleases the majority of the userbase. Don't take it personal if one or more of your uploads don't get approved. We've all been there, just live and learn. Details on how to appeal deletions that you see as unfair are on the [[howto:appeal|Deletion Appeals page]].

h4#uploading. Uploading

To upload a post, simply either paste the link into the "upload page":[/uploads/new], use the "bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or the "web extension":[https://github.com/danbooru/upload-to-danbooru]. Many of the most popular art sites are supported natively by Danbooru, so all it takes is pasting a link into the upload page. "See here":/static/bookmarklet for a list of supported sites.

Try not to upload images from sources that aren't from the original artist or a [[second-party source]] (official accounts for a game or anime in case of [[official art]], or a commissioner, etc), and always look for an [[help:image source|original source]] whenever possible. Sites such as 4chan, Reddit, or Facebook are not ideal places to source your image, unless the artist posted their art there or has long deleted their original post.

h5#source_your_upload. Source Your Upload

[b]See [[help:image_source]] for a complete help page on how to source your uploads.[/b] Sourcing images is especially important on Danbooru for both archiving and tracking purposes.

[b]Sourcing is NOT optional if your upload is not self-provided. Source your uploads as best as you can.[/b]

h5#minimal_tagging_criteria. Minimal Tagging Criteria

Comprehensive tagging is of the essence on Danbooru, [[unlimited blade works (reality marble)|its body and its blood]]. However, in cases where it is not yet possible to comprehensively tag an image as we would like, we have a minimum criteria for tagging new posts:

* Characters must be identified by name in the tags.
** Use the [[original]] tag if it's an original character.
** Place a [[character_request]] if you aren't sure where a character comes from.
* Artists must be credited. Read [[howto:artist]] for more information.
** Uploads must have at least an artist: tag
* Copyrights which a character is from must be identified.
** Place a [[copyright_request]] if you cannot surely identify it.
* Major body characteristics of characters must be identified. Be sure to include:
** [[tag group:hair styles|Hair styles]]
** [[tag group:hair color|Hair colors]]
** [[tag group:eyes tags|Eye colors]]
** [[tag group:attire|What the characters are wearing]]
* If you are not sure if an image is tagged completely enough, always place a [[tagme]] tag, and another contributor will review your tags, adding and making corrections as necessary. Do not frequently use [[tagme]] as an excuse for being too lazy to tag own uploads.

For Tagging Guidelines in greater detail, please see [[howto:tag]] and [[howto:tag_checklist]].

h5#make_use_of_comments_and_the_forum. Make Use of Comments, Discord and the Forum

Most of the time, a cursory trip to Google will help you accomplish most things such as finding out which copyright a character comes from. If you have an issue that where Google research just wouldn't do, please leave a comment on the image about the issue you want to clarify, or ask in the "Official Discord":https://discord.gg/danbooru or in the forums.

Also, please read the [[howto:comment|Commenting Guidelines]] to get an understanding about commenting on Danbooru.

h5#check_for_duplicates. Check for Duplicates

Be sure that your post has not been uploaded by someone else. When uploading an image, a list of similar images will appear at the bottom of the page.

If your image has already been uploaded, only upload if you have a higher quality copy. Once you have uploaded your higher quality copy, set all existing copies of the image as child posts of your copy.
Bigger size doesn't necessarily mean better quality, unless the filesizes vastly differ. For example, if one image is 800 kb and another is 840 kb, it's very likely they'll be [[duplicate]]s. Always check the images closely before uploading if you're unsure.

For more information on setting Parent and Child Posts, refer to the chapter on [[help:post_relationships|Managing Parent and Child Posts]] in the Contributor's Guide.

h4#see_also. See Also

* [[about:mod_queue|Moderation Queue]]
* [[howto:appeal|Deletion Appeals]]
* [[help:upload_rules|Upload Rules]]


[[howto:contribute|Return to the Contributor Guide]]
[[help:toc|Return to the Table of Contents]]
[[help:home|Return to the Wiki Help Home Page]]

title: unlimited_blade_works_(reality_marble)
body:
Unlimited Blade Works (UBW) is a Reality Marble, a world created by [[Archer (Fate)|]] from the [[Fate (series)|]] series. It is a wasteland, a vast [[field of blades]] stretching off into the distance with innumerable [[planted sword|swords planted]] into the ground.

It is commonly [[parody|parodied]], with other characters taking Archer's place, or with other items taking place of the swords.

The UBW can also store other types of weapons such as spears, shields, and the [[Rho Aias]], but it cannot store modern weapons like guns or bombs. It's the counter attack and antithesis of [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]]'s [[Gate of Babylon (Fate)|]].

An incantation is used by [[Archer (fate)|]] to invoke the Reality Marble:

[i]I am the bone of my sword.
Steel is my body, and fire is my blood.
I have created over a thousand blades.
Unknown to death.
Nor known to life.
Have withstood pain to create many weapons.
Yet, those hands will never hold anything.
So as I pray, 'Unlimited Blade Works'.[/i]

Other variations of the incantation exist that are performed by different versions of [[Emiya Shirou]].

Not to be confused with:

* [b]Unlimited Lost Works: The Void Creation of Swords[/b], the Noble Phantasm of [[EMIYA Alter]]. Unlike UBW which is a Reality Marble, EMIYA Alter's reality is inside of a bullet that when it is fired and hits an enemy, will manifest the reality from the inside out, doing deadly damage.
* [b]Originless Creation of Swords[/b], the Noble Phantasm of [[Senji Muramasa (Fate)|]]. It uses a landscape similar to UBW to create the ultimate katana, which can sever space, time, karma and fate.
* [[Fate/Unlimited Blade Works]], a story route in [[Fate/Stay Night]].

h4. Examples

* !post #498286
* !post #341082

h4. See also

* [[field of blades]]

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Unlimited Blade Works":[https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Unlimited_Blade_Works]

title: howto:rate
body:
Ratings are used to categorize content on Danbooru. Danbooru has four ratings: {{rating:general}}, {{rating:sensitive}}, {{rating:questionable}}, and {{rating:explicit}}.

Broadly speaking, these categories are:

* {{rating:general}} - G-rated content. Completely safe for work. Nothing sexualized or inappropriate to view in front of others.
* {{rating:sensitive}} - Ecchi, sexy, suggestive, or mildly erotic. Skimpy or [[revealing clothes]], [[swimsuit]]s, [[underwear]], images focused on the [[breasts]] or [[ass]], and anything else potentially not safe for work.
* {{rating:questionable}} - Softcore erotica. Simple nudity or near-nudity, but no explicit sex or exposed genitals.
* {{rating:explicit}} - Hardcore erotica. Explicit sex acts, exposed genitals, and bodily fluids.

h4. Guidelines

h6. {{Rating:General}}

* G-rated, completely safe for work content.
* Completely non-sexual scenes (fully clothed characters, innocent [[comic]]s and [[4koma]]s, [[portrait]]s, [[chibi]]s, cute things, etc).
* Content without people ([[scenery]], [[still life]]s, [[no humans]], [[text-only page]]s, [[food focus]], [[animal focus]], [[mecha]], SFW [[Pokemon (creature)|]], etc)
* Innocent displays of affection ([[hug]]ging, [[holding hands]], [[kiss]]ing that isn't sexually charged, etc)
* Trivial or cartoon violence (comedic or non-serious [[fighting]], minor [[head bump]]s, [[cuts]], [[blood]], or [[bruise]]s, or other [[injury|injuries]] that don't result in lasting harm).
* Legal drug use ([[smoking]] or drinking [[alcohol]]).
* Mild [[profanity]], insults, or rude gestures (e.g. [[middle finger]]) without lewd or sexual connotations.
* Note that anything involving child-like characters that is the least bit inappropriate or suggestive should not be rated G.

h6. {{Rating:Sensitive}}

* Ecchi, sexy, risqué, or suggestive content, even mildly so.
* Skimpy or [[revealing clothes]], including [[swimsuit]]s, [[lingerie]], [[underwear]], [[cleavage cutout]]s, [[playboy bunny]]suits, [[skin tight]] or [[impossible clothes]], etc.
* Anything focused on the [[ass]], [[breasts]], [[cleavage]], [[underboob]], [[sideboob]], [[feet]], [[armpits]], [[midriff]]/[[stomach]], [[navel]], [[lips]], or other sexualized parts of the body.
* Exposed [[groin]] area (hip lines) or [[dimples of venus]].
* [[Pantyshot]]s, [[upskirt]]s, and similar fanservice.
* Thin, [[see-through clothes|see-through]], or [[wet clothes]] that reveal the [[underwear]] or body underneath.
* Subtle [[cameltoe]]s or [[covered nipples]] not blatant enough for {{rating:questionable}}.
* Implied sexual situations (visible [[condom]]s, [[sex toy]]s in the background, [[penetration gesture]]s, etc)
* Mildly disturbing violence ([[blood]] or [[injury]] that is not G-rated).
* Depictions of thoughts of [[suicide]] or self-harm (including [[gun to head]]).
* Hard or illegal [[drugs|drug]] use.
* Anything not G-rated, not completely safe for work, or not completely safe to view in front of others.
* Anything you're not sure is safe enough for {{rating:general}}. When in doubt, use {{rating:sensitive}}.

h6. {{Rating:Questionable}}

* Simple non-genital nudity, including [[nipples]], [[areolae]], and bare [[ass]].
* Visible [[pussy|vulva]] or [[pubic hair]], if subtle and not blatantly exposed, such as in standing full-frontal nudity. "Blatantly exposed" means [[spread legs]], [[spread pussy]], [[presenting]], anything focused on the crotch, and anything where the [[pussy]] is fully visible.
* Near-nudity, such as highly [[revealing clothes]] or [[swimsuit]]s, clothing that barely hides nudity, and clothing that is partially removed or torn.
* Nipples or genitals clearly visible though clothing, including [[covered nipples]], pronounced [[cameltoe]]s, [[wedgie]]s, [[bulge]]s, and [[erection under clothes|erections under clothes]].
* Mild sexual contact ([[biting ear|ear biting]], [[groping]], [[grabbing another's breast]], heavy kissing, etc)
* Implied sex acts that aren't clearly shown.
* Simulated sex acts ([[simulated fellatio]], [[simulated footjob]], etc).
* Blatantly [[sexually suggestive]] situations ([[fellatio gesture]]s, [[oral invitation]]s, etc).
* [[Suggestive fluid]]s (unless they're obviously [[cum]] or [[pussy juice]], in which case they're {{rating:explicit}}).
* [[Bondage]], [[spanking]], [[BDSM]], and other fetish activities without visible sex acts or bodily fluids.
* [[Sex toy]]s that are plainly visible but aren't in use.
* Graphic or disturbing violence ([[death]], major blood or injury, [[ryona]], [[CBT]], serious [[abuse]]).

h6. {{Rating:Explicit}}

* Exposed genitals, including the [[pussy]], [[penis]], and [[anus]], whether [[censored]] or [[uncensored]].
* Explicit sex acts, including [[sex]], [[fellatio]], [[masturbation]], [[handjob]]s, [[fingering]], sex toy use, etc, whether [[censored]] or [[uncensored]].
* Bodily fluids, including [[cum]], [[used condom]]s, and [[pussy juice]].
* [[Guro]], [[scat]], extremely graphic violence (gore, dismemberment, etc), and NSFL content.

If you are unsure of what rating to use, post a comment or ask in topic #8495.

title: age_difference
body:
A pair (or more) of characters who are interacting with one another with a highly-visible apparent difference between their ages, based on visual cues such as physical maturity, size, etc.

If the difference in ages is not readily-apparent from the image itself (by cues such as physical maturity, size, etc), do not use this tag.  Similarly, the tag may be used for any picture where there appears to be a wide gap in age, as long as that is the logical conclusion from the image itself.

If it's same character in their different ages, use [[age comparison]].

h5. Pairings
* [[onee-loli]]: older woman and younger girl
* [[onee-shota]]: older woman and younger boy
* [[onii-shota]]: older man and younger boy

h4. See also

* [[height difference]]
* [[size difference]]

title: multiversus
body:
[b]MultiVersus[/b] is a free-to-play crossover fighting game developed by Player First Games and published by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment. 

Similar to Super Smash Brothers, the game features various characters owned by the Warner Brothers Discovery company including [[Warner Bros]]., [[DC Comics]], HBO, Turner Entertainment, [[Adult Swim]] and [[Cartoon Network]].

On January 31st, 2025, "it was announced":[https://x.com/multiversus/status/1885327981758865568] that Season 5 would be the last update, ending on May 30th, 2025. The game would remain playable offline.

title: magic_trick
body:
A performing art that entertains audiences by staging tricks or creating illusions of seemingly impossible or supernatural feats using natural means.
A professional who performs such [[illusion|illusions]] is called a stage [[magician]] or an illusionist.
In many cases, items such as [[pigeon|pigeons]], [[top hat|silk hat]]s, and [[playing card]]s are used in magic.

h5. Named Tricks
* [[from hat trick]]
* [[levitating orange trick]]
* [[detachable thumb]]

title: mage_staff
body:
An ornate [[staff]] often carried by [[magic]] users, and used as focusing implement for [[casting spell]]s. Often decorated with [[gem]]s, [[crystal]]s and metal bands; or is carved from gnarled wood with knobbly/curly projections at the end. Sometimes both.

Not to be confused with a [[wand]], [[scepter]] or [[crosier]].

h4. Notable examples

* [[Gandalf]] ([[The Lord of the Rings]]) 
* [[Megumin]] ([[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!]])
* [[Roxy Migurdia]] ([[Mushoku Tensei]])
* [[Negi Springfield]] ([[Mahou Sensei Negima!]])
* [[Dela Delon]] ([[Brandish]])

h4. See also

* [[wand]]
* [[scepter]]
* [[crosier]]
* [[Rod of Asclepius]]
* [[Caduceus]]

title: wand
body:
A thin, straight, hand-held stick made of wood, stone, ivory, or metal, with ceremonial or magical significance.

In fiction, it is generally used as a magical tool to cast or channel magic just like a [[mage staff|magical staff]]. Differences between a stave and a wand include a staff being larger (several feet long, about the length of a walking stick and held one- or two-handed) than a wand (usually shorter than two feet, held in one hand or a few fingers) and that a wand is often used in less "serious" works especially by fairies or fairy godmothers and can imply a playful form of magic.

[[Laevatein (touhou)|]], associated with [[Flandre Scarlet]], is an example of a more unusual wand.

Not to be confused with [[conductor baton]], sometimes also referred to as a wand.

title: psychopomp_(helmet)
body:
The helmet [[C'venash Vishneri]] created and wears in [[Psychopomp (game)|]].

She called it the "Machine That Lets me Read People's Minds when I Want To" or, "[[Psychopomp (game)|]]" for short.

The helmet is a "piece of solid metal":[https://www.tumblr.com/fadingclub/758822694780321792/someone-may-have-already-asked-this-but-is-the?source=share] and is not particularly based on any real helmet.
Its appearance consists of:
* Two [[radio antenna]]s on the right
* A [[satellite dish]] or [[radar dish]] on the left
* Three (or four) [[prayer flag]]s on "both sides of the cans":[https://fadingclub.tumblr.com/post/766635121079156736/in-a-few-places-of-psychopomp-gold-cvenashs]
* A metal plate screwed directly to the front

title: ump9_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP9]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

UMP9 has orange hair worn in twintails, and wears an outfit similar to [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]] consisting of a [[white shirt]], a [[jacket]], [[black pantyhose]]. She has orange eyes and has a [[scar across eye|scar on the right eye]], in the opposite side of UMP45.

UMP9 is the most cheerful of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]] and is particularly attached to the idea of family. UMP9 is considered UMP45's little sister, and trusts UMP45 very much. Would receive a [[UMP9 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

Prior to meeting UMP45, she called herself Lenna, and she returns to using that name in [[lenna (girls' frontline 2)|her appearance]] in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]]. She is voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]].

title: ump45_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP45]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Has [[grey hair|grey]]-[[brown hair|dull-brown hair]] worn with [[one side up]], and wears a fairly practical (by fictional standards) outfit consisting of a [[white shirt]], a [[jacket]], [[black pantyhose]] and exoskeleton. She has [[brown eyes]] and has a [[scar across eye|scar on the left eye]].

UMP45 is portrayed as the older sister of [[UMP9 (girls' frontline)|]], sister (mostly young) of [[UMP40 (girls' frontline)|]], and is the leader of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]]. UMP45 is often portrayed in the fandom as being the butt of [[flat chest]] jokes, often from either UMP9 or [[M37 (girls' frontline)|]]. Would receive a [[UMP45 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In her appearance in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], she would go by the name [[Leva (Girls' Frontline 2)|]].

Her original illustrator [[Infukun]] adapted her design from one of [[Renatus.Z]]'s Pixiv Fantasia characters, [[Renatus (pixiv fantasia)|]] (hence why they are credited as ZAGALA). Following Infukun's departure, other illustrators have picked her up to do her skins. She is voiced by Mineuchi Tomomi.

A light novel by Goji Shouji (五示正司) with illustrations by [[Booota]].
A manga adaptation is done by [[bibi02]].

title: versailles_no_bara
body:
Lit. "The Rose of Versailles", also known as [i]Lady Oscar[/i] or [i]La Rose de Versailles[/i].

One of the best-known titles in shōjo manga and a media franchise created by Riyoko Ikeda. It has been adapted into several [[Takarazuka Revue]] musicals, as well an anime television series, produced by Tokyo Movie Shinsha and broadcast by the anime television network Animax and Nippon Television.
